greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that A325977(n) has the same sign as A325978(n).
comment: Here A325977(n) = A325973(n) - n and A325978(n) = n - A325974(n), where A325973(n) is the average of {sum of unitary divisors} and {sum of squarefree divisors} = (1/2) * (A034448(n) + A048250(n)) while A325974(n) is the average of {sum of non-unitary divisors} and {sum of nonsquarefree divisors} = (1/2)*(A048146(n) + A162296(n)). Only if signs of A325977(n) and A325978(n) are equal, can their difference A325978(n) - A325977(n) = (n - A325974(n)) - (A325973(n) - n) = 2n - (A325973(n)+A325974(n)) = 2n - A000203(n) = A033879(n) be zero, which happens when n is a perfect number (in A000396).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) isA326070(n) = (sign(A325977(n))==sign(A325978(n))); \\ For other needed code, see under A325975.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 07 2019
